item.title: Configuring GCS Cloud Storage
item.description: This page provides guidance for configuring GCS Cloud Storage provider for use with Polaris. It covers credential vending, IAM roles, ACL requirements, and best practices to ensure secure and reliable integration. All catalog operations in Polaris for Google Cloud Storage (GCS)—including listing, reading, and writing objects—are performed using credential vending, which issues scoped (vended) tokens for secure access. Polaris requires both IAM roles and Hierarchical Namespace (HNS) ACLs (if HNS is enabled) to be properly configured.
